## About The Project

![Screen Shot](Screenshot%202023-07-18%20183314.png)

This project is a Myntra UI Clone developed using the Flutter framework. It aims to showcase the user interface of the Myntra app, including a login page and a clone of the Myntra Insider page.

This Flutter app aims to replicate the user interface and basic features of the Myntra app. It demonstrates the use of various Flutter widgets and components to create a visually appealing and responsive UI. The app includes the following key features:

Home Page: A screen representing the Myntra home page with a variety of fashion products and scrolling functionality.

Login Page: A login screen that allows users to log in using their credentials.

Myntra Insider Page: A page similar to Myntra Insider showcasing loyalty rewards and offers for Myntra users.

## Built With

The Myntra UI Clone is built using the following technologies and tools:

Flutter Framework: Flutter is an open-source UI software development kit (SDK) developed by Google. It is used to build natively compiled applications for mobile, web, and desktop from a single codebase. Flutter uses the Dart programming language and provides a rich set of pre-designed widgets to create beautiful and responsive user interfaces.

Android Studio: Android Studio is the official integrated development environment (IDE) for Android app development. It provides advanced tools and features for building, testing, and debugging Flutter applications for the Android platform.

## Getting Started

Follow these instructions to get the app up and running on your local machine for development and testing purposes.

### Prerequisites

Make sure you have the following installed:

* Flutter SDK
An Android/iOS emulator or a physical device to run the app

### Installation

1. Clone the repository to your local machine:

```sh
git clone https://github.com/your-username/myntra_ui_clone.git
```

2. Navigate to the project directory:

```sh
cd myntra_ui_clone
```

3. Fetch the dependencies:

```sh
flutter pub get
```

4. Run the app:

```sh
flutter run
```
